_header: Jack Trueman doth you to understand
Title(s): Epistle on the Abuses of the Age
Subjects: letters; abuses, of the age; evils of the time; chronicles, verse in; Peasants’ Revolt (1381)
_description: Jack Trueman’s Epistle on the Abuses of the Age — eleven irregular lines

BLCottClauEIII.First Lines:
Jakke Trewman doth yow to vnderstandeThat falsenesse and gyle haue
                    regned to lang…
BLCottClauEIII.Last Lines:
…And clerkus for welthe worthe hem wooGod do bote for nowe is
                    tyme

BLCottTibCVII.Transcription:
Iakke Trewman doþ ȝow to understandeþat falsnes and
                    gyle haviþ regned to longand trewþe hat bene sette under a
                    lokkeand falnet regneth in euerylk flokkeNo man may come trewþe
                    tobut he syng de dederoSpeke spende and spedequoth Ion of
                    Banthonand þerfore synne fareth as wylde flodetrew love is away
                    þat was so godeand clerkus for welthe worche hem woGod do bote
                    for now is tyme
